alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 14 at 4:00PM CST until December 14 at 4:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN ST. BERNARD...SOUTHWESTERN ORLEANS AND NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON PARISHES... At 400 PM CST, a confirmed tornado was located near Gretna, or near Harvey, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, East New Orleans, Harvey, Chalmette, Gretna, Arabi, Terrytown and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 235 and 248. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 near mile marker 4. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
